SEARCH
Package com.nickslibrary.datastructures.heaps

Class MinHeap<T extends Comparable<T>>

java.lang.Object
com.nickslibrary.datastructures.heaps.MinHeap<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type of elements in the heap, must be Comparable.
public class MinHeap<T extends Comparable<T>> extends Object
Implementation of a MinHeap using an array-based structure.

    Constructs a MinHeap with the given initial capacity.

    Constructs a MinHeap from an existing collection of elements.

  • Constructor Details

    • MinHeap

      public MinHeap(int capacity)
      Constructs a MinHeap with the given initial capacity.
      Parameters:
      capacity - The maximum number of elements the heap can hold initially.

    • MinHeap

      public MinHeap(Collection<T> elements)
      Constructs a MinHeap from an existing collection of elements. This efficiently builds the heap using the heapify process.
      Parameters:
      elements - The collection of elements to initialize the heap.

  • Method Details

    • insert

      public void insert(T value)
      Inserts a new element into the heap.
      Parameters:
      value - The value to insert.

    • insertAll

      public void insertAll(T[] values)
      Inserts multiple elements into the heap. This method efficiently builds the heap using the heapify process.
      Parameters:
      values - The array of values to insert.

    • extractMin

      public T extractMin()
      Removes and returns the minimum element from the heap.
      Returns:
      The smallest element in the heap.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the heap is empty.

    • peek

      public T peek()
      Returns the minimum element without removing it.
      Returns:
      The smallest element in the heap.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the heap is empty.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of elements in the heap.
      Returns:
      The size of the heap.

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the heap is empty.
      Returns:
      True if the heap is empty, false otherwise.

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Clears all elements from the heap.
